website_summaries.verdict: Durable, lightweight, and supportive are the top takeaways of the New Balance 796v2. Whether propelling towards the net or making those defensive shots along the baseline, this trainer won’t drag you down. Its well-cushioned REVlite midsole cradles your foot during landings and grants you the needed responsiveness on subsequent push-offs. You can snag all these winning points without hurting your budget.
pros: Most of the satisfied buyers revel about how ultra-lightweight the New Balance 796 v2 is
Cushioning hasn't been an issue for many pleased users
A majority of the reviews reveal that this trainer requires no break-in time
Many of the playtesters claim that this hardcourt footgear offers excellent mobility
A considerable number of those who find it durable say that it can withstand long hours of play
Lots of wearers assert that it’s backed up with a superb support structure
It’s one of the most affordable tennis shoes from New Balance
cons: Few wearers affirm that the tongue of this trainer is partly long that it rubs against the collar
Some say that the wide-width option of the New Balance 796v2 is deceiving as it feels rather narrow

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality and price
customer_reviews.text: Shoes seem to be OK. Good fit, good traction and reasonably comfortable. I’ve worn them for about 6hrs of Pickleball now and they seem to be wearing pretty well (holding up well). Typical however, there isn’t much cushion so I have replaced the insoles with aftermarket gel inserts that are much better (I highly recommend this if using on hard court surfaces, which these are designed for. I do this for most all athletic shoes actually). Gave 4 stars since the color of the left shoe is slightly darker than the right. Can’t figure that out, but it’s a bit annoying, but not so much that I cared to return them. Otherwise a decent shoe, not stellar though.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck S

customer_reviews.title: SIZE IS MISLEADING
customer_reviews.text: New Balance shoes are the only shoes I wear. I own about 15 pair. Always 8 1/2 to 9D. This is much narrower than all my other shoes, right about where the arch is. New Balance really screwed up here. Long time buyers used to be able to find the newer model of a pair of shoes that they like but not any more. I wish somebody at New Balance would listen to their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Width is accurate compared to the 1006
customer_reviews.text: I wore 1004 4e, 1005 4e. Once NB made the 1006 the toe width got narrow. I figured I’d try these and they were comfortable for a 3 hour match. I don’t know how durable they will be but for now they were worth the money. I’m editing because after 6 weeks these shoes are not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Rich W

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Court Shoes I've found
customer_reviews.text: I play ALOT of pickleball and platform tennis. Both are tough on shoes. Time will tell about the durability. But from a fit, weight, and mobility standpoint, these IMO are best in class. I've tried several major brands and the umpteen different models they offer. I even tried other New Balance models. All we're either too rigid, too loose, heavy, etc. Thank goodness for amazons return policy. Not mentioned, they look good too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, great value
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as he expected....put on and played from day one, no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: J W

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too small
customer_reviews.text: The NB Court show was a great looking shoe, well-made. Unfortunately, it was too tight in the toe and not quite wide enough. Although I always order NB shoes in sz 11 and they always fit well, this particular model did not. I also ordered a 2nd NB model (same size) which fit perfectly. Go figure!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lavor

customer_reviews.title: The available 2 E width makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: Nice to find a shoe that fits comfortably while not being long enough to add more toes -- end-to-end. Look forward to many matches wearing my New Balance 'fit'!
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Horrible order after use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these sneakers in late July. I have worn them a hand full of times and noted a very foul odor after each use. I have always played sports and have never had this problem with any other court shoes in the past. Because I have gone over the return window, I am forced to throw these shoes away and buy a different pair. I am so disappointed. I paid over $84.00 for these sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jill B. Talcovitz

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Purchased the 4E wide size 7.5. Fit was perfect for my wide feet. Almost no breakin needed. Will be using as a training shoe for pickleball.
customer_reviews.author: LonnieT

customer_reviews.title: 4E too narrrow/low for my foot issues
customer_reviews.text: Attractive style but too narrow and low for my wide, high instep, hammer toed feet. They killed my hammer toe. New Balance is my go to for racquetball and walking sneakers but these are narrower and lower at the toe than the 608s I uaually wear. Should have returned but kept past the return limit trying to break them in. My bad
customer_reviews.author: Robs

customer_reviews.title: Bad sole
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff sole...feels like the sole is made up of wood! Looks nice but sole is very bad.
customer_reviews.author: Shres

customer_reviews.title: These are the Real Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Perform crazy good on hard-court Tennis surfaces. Comfortable and supportive. Love the Lemon Yellow color.
customer_reviews.author: Mobiustrip

customer_reviews.title: Run short and narrow
customer_reviews.text: I had to go up a half size and go wider because these run very narrow and short. Normally i would wear a 7 D width but with these i feel best in 7.5 extra wide!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Leventhal

customer_reviews.title: Nice tennis shoes
customer_reviews.text: Backup pair of tennis shoes would not be my first choice but decent
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Feel fit my wide foot and match size too. Thank you for sent me shoe. I will order again next September Labor Day 2021.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Crowson

customer_reviews.title: Great Tennis Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoe wears very well on hard courts, fits Well and has great cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sypkens

customer_reviews.title: Got great
customer_reviews.text: Durable for Pickleball. I have had them since May 2020. I play 3 to 4 times a week on the hard courts. They are starting to wear out, so I ordered another pair. I have tried different brands and they usually only last 3 to 4 mo this. I’m happy they have lasted 6 months. I did have to put a aftermarket insole in them to make them more comfortable. Fit was great. Didn’t improve my game, but my feet feel good.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Arnett

product_meta.title: New Balance Unisex Adults’ MCH796PE Industrial Shoe, Blanco, 5.5 UK
product_meta.description: Stay light on your feet while you make the shot in the men’s 796v1 Paddle Tennis shoe. The low-to-the-ground design is made to be ultra-reactive with an exceptional court feel for optimal control. REVlite midsole foam offers famously lightweight underfoot support amidst lateral movements, while an Ndurance outsole provides superior durability for high wear. Features: - Innovative REVlite midsole provides premium responsiveness and durability at a 30% lighter weight than other foams with comparable performance - N-Durance rubber compound for maximum outsole durability - No sew overlays in optimal areas - Non-marking outsole Specifications: - Synthetic/mesh upper Technology: REV Lite: - An innovative foam compound providing the same responsiveness and durability of New Balance foams 30% heavier. REVlite offers a lightweight ride without minimizing construction or sacrificing underfoot cushioning or stability. Ndurance: - Rubber compound for maximum durability used in high wear areas.
